thread.title: Oceanside dominates Belfast in finale, playoffs on-deck
thread.title_full: Oceanside dominates Belfast in finale, playoffs on-deck

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Ken Waltz)
title: Oceanside dominates Belfast in finale, playoffs on-deck
text:
High school football Oceanside dominates Belfast in finale, playoffs on-deck After coin flip, No. 6 Mariners will play rematch with No. 3 MDI on Oct. 30 By Ken Waltz | Oct 25, 2015 Photo by: Ken Waltz Oceanside's Nate Raye (7) is on the move as teammate Thomas Curtis, as well as Belfast's Nolan Woods, left, and Brandon Porter, back, trail the play during an Oct. 23 high school football game on Wasgatt Field in Rockland. The Mariners beat the Lions 48-10. 
Rockland — The Oceanside football team is headed to the playoffs and will carry a dominating final regular-season performance into that postseason contest. 
The Mariners ended their campaign on Friday night, Oct. 23 with a strong 48-10 high school gridiron win over Belfast on Wasgatt Memorial Field. 
Additional information, video and link to more photos from this game will appear later with this story. See more photos below. 
Oceanside finished with a .500 season and has qualified for the postseason. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Crabtree Point Standings for Class C North, Oceanside (4-4, 100.0000 points) finished tied for fifth with Foxcroft Academy of Dover-Foxcroft (4-4, 100.0000 points) and the schools had a coin flip to determine which would fill the fifth and sixth (final) spots for the postseason. 
The Ponies won the flip, said Oceanside athletic director Molly Bishop. 
Thus, the Mariners ended sixth and will play at No. 3 Mount Desert Island (6-2, 124.2063 points) on Friday, Oct. 30 at 7 p.m. in a playoff clash. 
The Trojans beat the Mariners 42-13 in a home game during the regular season. 
If Oceanside had finished fifth, it would have traveled to face Madison/Carrabec (4-4, 104.8387 points) in the first playoff contest. The Mariners opened the season with a 35-18 loss to host Madison/Carrabec. 
Friday's playoff game will give the Mariners an opportunity for redemption from that regular-season loss to the Trojans. However, MDI is strong, having only lost to the top two teams in the region — Winslow and Old Town. 
This season, the Mariners, who rebounded with a 4-2 record after losing their first two games, were outscored by opponents 254-214, but that is made to look worse due to a 68-0 loss to Winslow. 
MDI outscored opponents 257-137 this season. 
Against Belfast on Friday, the Mariners grabbed the momentum early and played four solid quarters of football. Oceanside led 23-10 at halftime. 
The Lion points came on a safety when the Mariner punter stepped on the back line of the end zone and on a touchdown catch following a blocked punt. 
The Mariners had many highlights, including a long touchdown catch by Riley Sprague. 
Belfast finished 3-5 on the season and out of playoff contention. Belfast's Grey Dinsmore, left, and Oceanside's Isaiah Green. (Photo by: Ken Waltz) A slew of Lions, in white, and Mariners, in blue.
